definition: unpleasant to hear/grates on the ear (of home truths)
contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
loyal advice jars on the ears (idiom)
speech that grates on the ear (idiom); bitter truths/home truths (that one does not want to hear)

sentences.english: The feeling is supposed to come after we're done. We're supposed to feel good by accomplishing.
sentences.chinese: 然而，要是你一點也不想聽那些逆耳忠言怎麼辦？

sentences.english: My words must be gall and wormwood to him.
sentences.chinese: 我的話在他聽來一定逆耳。

sentences.english: What most works for one's growth is honest advice unpleasant to the ear.
sentences.chinese: 最有助於一個人成長的是逆耳忠言。

sentences.english: I talk to him with brutal frankness.
sentences.chinese: 本人對他講的話，固然逆耳，倒是忠言。

sentences.english: Nixon was less likely to brush off the bearer of unwelcome intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松不大可能對他的逆耳之言置之不理。

sentences.english: It is time for the CPC who boast himself to be great, glorious and correct to wake up.
sentences.chinese: 忠言逆耳，一貫自詡偉大光榮正確的中共，該醒了。

sentences.english: Bitter medicine cures sickness; unpalataBle advice Benefits conduct.
sentences.chinese: 良藥苦口利於病，忠言逆耳益於行。

sentences.english: Persephone was the daughter of Zeus and Demeter.
sentences.chinese: 泊爾塞福涅是宙斯和德墨逆耳的女兒。

sentences.english: Ok, today the topic of my speech is "Bad Words Did Good Things."
sentences.chinese: 那麼，今天我演講的題目是“忠言逆耳”。

sentences.english: Unless his conduct improves, he'll have to be told a few home truths.
sentences.chinese: 除非他的行爲有所改進，否則他就得聽到逆耳忠言。

definition: loyal advice jars on the ears (idiom)
loyal advice/sincere advice
speech that grates on the ear (idiom); bitter truths/home truths (that one does not want to hear)
to reprove/forthright admonition
good medicine tastes bitter (idiom); fig. frank criticism is hard to swallow
lit. bitter taste (cf good medicine tastes bitter 良藥苦口|良药苦口)/fig. earnestly (of warning, advice)
pleasing to the ear
false/untrue to one's convictions/against one's will/disloyal
gems of wisdom (idiom); priceless advice
to say sth without meaning it (idiom); to speak tongue in cheek/saying one thing but meaning sth different
good words
words from the bottom of one's heart
major principle/general truth/sermon (reproof)/bombastic talk
to persist in one's views
advice/to advise
nice to hear/worth listening to
